Subject: Re: [junit] running junit method from ant build
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=257370492; y=bnvHuGH94x9OZdoHWa89ynFlGbLiK4Jydxn6rj4urVLhK2sbxgeU0w

It is possible with JUnit 3.8.1 (so probably with 3.8, too) and also 
with JUnit 4.

I have done that in my patch for the Ant's <junit> task. You can see the 
source code patch if you download source code of NetBeans 6.5 (just 
released) and build them. In directory junit/external, file 
Ant-1.7.1-binary-patch-72080.jar will be generated (during the build 
phase). The root of this .jar archive contains the source code patch.

The patch is both for JUnit 3.8.x and JUnit 4.x and it allows to specify 
more than one test method name. In the patch, the most significant 
changes are those in files JUnitTestRunner.java and 
JUnit4TestMethodAdapter.java (new file).
